author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
The authorities on Monday imposed curfew-like restrictions in parts of Srinagar to stop the Shia sect’s protests over the execution of Sheikh Nimr Al-Nimr by the Saudi Arabian government.

There were attempts to take out a protest march in Rainawari.

However, the police chased away the protesters. In Srinagar’s Saidakadal and Zadibal, tear-smoke shells were burst to disperse the protesters.

Heavy deployment of security forces was made in areas having significant Shia populations in Budgam and Srinagar districts. Rainawari and Zadibal were kept out of bounds with concertina wires.

Meanwhile, Shia cleric and senior separatist leader Aagha Syed Hasan appealed to the Shia community for calm.
title: Curbs imposed in J&K to stop Shia protests
